subject: Re: [junit] Re: No tests found warning in ecilpse test runner
msgSnippet: Paul, I m sorry I missed your message on the first pass.  As I understand it, your problem is: 1) MockRunner has a concrete subclass of TestCase without any
messageBody:
Paul,

I'm sorry I missed your message on the first pass. As I understand it,
your problem is:

1) MockRunner has a concrete subclass of TestCase without any test methods
2) Eclipse tries to run this class, which fails, because it has no test
methods.

Are all your real test classes in one package? If so, you can configure
continuous testing to run only that package, and not the whole project.
Would that be helpful?

David Saff

Paul Andrews wrote:
> I have the exact same problem - i.e. trying to use MockRunner in
> Eclipse. This is compounded by the fact that I am using the continuous
> test plugin which executes these tests automatically using the
> built-in Eclipse junit mechanism and keeps telling me that my tests
> have failed. So it isn't an option for me to run the tests some other way.
>
>
>
>
